Module chav1961.purelib
Package chav1961.purelib.streams.interfaces

Interface JsonSaxHandler

All Known Subinterfaces:
JsonSaxDeserializer<T>
public interface JsonSaxHandler

This interface describes a SAX-styled handler to parse JSON input data.

Similar to SAX parsers for XML, this interface processed any events on parsing data for the JSON input stream. To optimize parsing performance, all string-related methods can process as raw char array data, so data converted into string. Optional ability for the interface is an implementation of automatic decoding all 'names' in the input JSON to it's predefined ids to use them directly in the switch statements

Life cycle of the interface is:

startDoc()
startArr() [
startIndex(int)
startObj() {
startName(char[], int, int) "name1"
:
value() null
endName()
endObj() }
endIndex()
,
startIndex(int)
startObj() {
startName(char[], int, int) "name2"
:
value(char[], int, int) "value"
endName()
endObj() }
endIndex()
endArr() ]
endDoc()
Since:
0.0.1
Author:
Alexander Chernomyrdin aka chav1961
See Also:
JsonSaxParser, RFC 7159

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void endArr()
    This event is fired on every closed ']'
    void endDoc()
    This event is fired on the end of the document
    void endIndex()
    This event is fired after any new value of the array element
    void endName()
    This event is fired on every 'name' termination in the object.
    void endObj()
    This event is fired on every closed '}'
    void startArr()
    This event is fired on every opened '['
    void startDoc()
    This event is fired on the start of the document
    void startIndex​(int index)
    This event is fired before any new value of the array element
    void startName​(char[] data, int from, int len)
    This event is fired on every 'name' in the object.
    void startName​(long id)
    This event is fired on every 'name' in the object.
    void startName​(java.lang.String name)
    This event is fired on every 'name' in the object.
    void startObj()
    This event is fired on every opened '{'
    void value()
    This event is fired on every null value in the JSON input.
    void value​(boolean data)
    This event is fired on every boolean value in the JSON input.
    void value​(char[] data, int from, int len)
    This event is fired on every string value in the JSON input.
    void value​(double data)
    This event is fired on every double value in the JSON input.
    void value​(long data)
    This event is fired on every long integer value in the JSON input.
    void value​(java.lang.String data)
    This event is fired on every string value in the object.

  • Method Details

    • startDoc

      void startDoc() throws ContentException

      This event is fired on the start of the document

      Throws:
      ContentException - if any content problems was detected

    • endDoc

      void endDoc() throws ContentException

      This event is fired on the end of the document

      Throws:
      ContentException - if any content problems was detected

    • startObj

      void startObj() throws ContentException

      This event is fired on every opened '{'

      Throws:
      ContentException - if any content problems was detected

    • endObj

      void endObj() throws ContentException

      This event is fired on every closed '}'

      Throws:
      ContentException - if any content problems was detected

    • startArr

      void startArr() throws ContentException

      This event is fired on every opened '['

      Throws:
      ContentException - if any content problems was detected

    • endArr

      void endArr() throws ContentException

      This event is fired on every closed ']'

      Throws:
      ContentException - if any content problems was detected

    • startName

      void startName​(char[] data, int from, int len) throws ContentException

      This event is fired on every 'name' in the object. Differ to startName(String), name will not contain any escapes!

      Parameters:
      data - char arrays contained name
      from - starting position of the name in the array
      len - length of the name detected
      Throws:
      ContentException - if any content problems was detected

    • startName

      void startName​(java.lang.String name) throws ContentException

      This event is fired on every 'name' in the object. This method is optional and will never be called by JsonSaxParser. To use it, implement startName(char[], int, int) method as:

      startName(new String(data,from,len));
      Parameters:
      name - 'name' detected.
      Throws:
      ContentException - if any content problems was detected

    • startName

      void startName​(long id) throws ContentException

      This event is fired on every 'name' in the object. This method is optional and will never be called by JsonSaxParser. It was reserved to use with the AndOrTree. To use it, implement startName(char[], int, int) method as:

      startName(treeFromLorien.seekName(data,from,len));
      Parameters:
      id - predefined long id of the name was detected. Use switch ((int)id) {...} to operate with it
      Throws:
      ContentException - if any content problems was detected

    • endName

      void endName() throws ContentException

      This event is fired on every 'name' termination in the object. Single values terminate name after it's value, arrays and objects terminate names after exhausting it's data

      Throws:
      ContentException - if any content problems was detected

    • startIndex

      void startIndex​(int index) throws ContentException

      This event is fired before any new value of the array element

      Parameters:
      index - index of the new array element
      Throws:
      ContentException - if any content problems was detected

    • endIndex

      void endIndex() throws ContentException

      This event is fired after any new value of the array element

      Throws:
      ContentException - if any content problems was detected

    • value

      void value​(char[] data, int from, int len) throws ContentException

      This event is fired on every string value in the JSON input. Differ to value(String), value will not contain any escapes!

      Parameters:
      data - source array containing string data
      from - starting position of the string data was detected
      len - length of the string was detected
      Throws:
      ContentException - if any content problems was detected

    • value

      void value​(java.lang.String data) throws ContentException

      This event is fired on every string value in the object. This method is optional and will never be called by JsonSaxParser. To use it, implement value(char[], int, int) method as:

      value(new String(data,from,len));
      Parameters:
      data - value was extracted from JSON input
      Throws:
      ContentException - if any content problems was detected

    • value

      void value​(long data) throws ContentException

      This event is fired on every long integer value in the JSON input.

      Parameters:
      data - value was extracted from JSON input
      Throws:
      ContentException - if any content problems was detected

    • value

      void value​(double data) throws ContentException

      This event is fired on every double value in the JSON input.

      Parameters:
      data - value was extracted from JSON input
      Throws:
      ContentException - if any content problems was detected

    • value

      void value​(boolean data) throws ContentException

      This event is fired on every boolean value in the JSON input.

      Parameters:
      data - value was extracted from JSON input
      Throws:
      ContentException - if any content problems was detected

    • value

      void value() throws ContentException

      This event is fired on every null value in the JSON input.

      Throws:
      ContentException - if any content problems was detected
